remarks: Discard the first few terms of a sequence that starts with all zeroes (or whatever the identity ` Z ` is for operation ` .+ ` ).  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Jul-2013.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 27-May-2014.)
statement:
seqid.1 $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. S ) -> ( Z .+ x ) = x ) $.
seqid.2 $e |- ( ph -> Z e. S ) $.
seqid.3 $e |- ( ph -> N e. ( ZZ>= ` M ) ) $.
seqid.4 $e |- ( ph -> ( F ` N ) e. S ) $.
seqid.5 $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. ( M ... ( N - 1 ) ) ) -> ( F ` x ) = Z ) $.
seqid $p |- ( ph -> ( seq M ( .+ , F ) |` ( ZZ>= ` N ) ) = seq N ( .+ , F ) ) $.
$d .+ x $.
$d F x $.
$d M x $.
$d N x $.
$d S x $.
$d Z x $.
$d ph x $.
